climbs.name: There's A Snake in My Boot

content.description: Start on marked start holds, right hand low dirty sidepull and left hand small edge. Feet for the start aren't the best but once you figure them out and pull off avoiding the dab to make the first move up and left staying on the arete the crux is over (dabbing) is over. Continue with one or two more moves using the arete and then work your way into the crimp/side pulls on the face. Work your way left until you can reach the crack on the lip of the boulder and then choose between a few good holds above to find your way to the top. Once again avoid dabbing on the adjacent rock that will be directly behind/below you as you top.
content.location: Right side of the tree boulder. Watch out for the snake hole hidden by the tall grass/weeds right below your feet.

content.description: Start as for Snake in my Boot. Again an awkard start for taller people. From the start holds shoot straight up and work your way up the slab directly above. After the first move everything goes as a 0. See picture for Snake in my Boot for line.
content.location: Same start as Snake in my Boot.

content.description: Starts on right side of the front of the boulder. Start on marked start holds (see picture under charlie brown), left hand jug and right hand less of a jug. Work your way left on juggy lip until you reach the section of rock next to charlie brown that is lighter in color then top out. Fairly fun v0.
content.location: Right side of the front side of the Tree boulder.

content.description: Short problem on jugs. Sit start on far left front side of the boulder where the rock makes a 90+ish degree turn. Start however youd like from sitting and work straight up. One or two moves. Not an amazing route, used to kickoff the start of some boulder development in the area after a long day of sport climbing.
content.location: Far left side of the front portion of the boulder (face located closes to campsites)
